Paragraph: Tubular proteinuria and oxidative stress were induced by a single injection of maleate ( 400 mg / kg ) in rats .

1. Tubular proteinuria: This is a medical condition where there is an abnormal amount of protein in the urine, specifically in the tubular part of the kidneys. It is considered a symptom or a sign of various kidney diseases.

Therefore, Tubular proteinuria is the disease entity in the paragraph.

Chemical.content:
Please identify the "Chemical" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Tubular proteinuria and oxidative stress were induced by a single injection of maleate ( 400 mg / kg ) in rats .

Let's think step by step.

1. Tubular proteinuria: This is a medical condition where excessive amounts of proteins are found in the urine, specifically in the tubular part of the kidneys. Proteins are not typically found in urine in large quantities, so their presence indicates some damage or dysfunction in the kidneys.
2. Maleate: This is a chemical compound with the formula CH2(COOH)2. It is an organic acid with two carboxylate groups. Maleic acid is the parent compound, and its anhydride and esters are also known as maleates. In the context of the paragraph, it is the substance that was injected into the rats to induce tubular proteinuria and oxidative stress.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Chemical.
1. Maleate (CH2(COOH)2) - the chemical compound injected into the rats.

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.
